fields.name: All-or-Nothing Thinking
fields.description: All-or-Nothing Thinking. You view things in absolute, black-and-white categories

fields.name: Overgeneralization
fields.description: Overgeneralization. You view a negative event as a never-ending pattern of defeat: 'This always happens!'

fields.name: Mental Filter
fields.description: Mental Filter. You dwell on the negatives and ignore the positives.

fields.name: Discounting the Positive
fields.description: Discounting the Positive. You insist that your positive qualities don't count.

fields.name: Mind-Reading
fields.description: Mind-Reading. You jump to conclusions not warranted by the facts. You assume that people are reacting negatively to you.

fields.name: Fortune-Telling
fields.description: Fortune-Telling. You jump to conclusions not warranted by the facts. You predict that things will turn out badly.

fields.name: Magnification and Minimization
fields.description: Magnification and Minimization. You blow things out of proportion or shrink them.

fields.name: Emotional Reasoning
fields.description: Emotional Reasoning. You reason from your feelings: 'I feel like an idiot, so I must really be one.'

fields.name: Should Statements
fields.description: Should Statements. You use shoulds, shouldn'ts, musts, oughts, and have tos

fields.name: Labeling
fields.description: Labeling. Instead of saying, 'I made a mistake,' you say, 'I'm a jerk' or 'I'm a loser.'

fields.name: Self-Blame
fields.description: Self-Blame. You find fault instead of solving the problem. You blame yourself for something you weren't entirely responsible for.

fields.name: Other-Blame
fields.description: Other-Blame. You find fault instead of solving the problem. You blame others and overlook ways you contributed to the problem.
